docblock.description: Main framework class file.
Liber is a main class of framework.
docblock.long-description:
How to setup configuration params:

Liber::conf('APP_MODE', 'PROD');

and to get params:

Liber::conf('APP_MODE');

There are many params that can be used:

BASE_PATH        ->  Internal path to Framework;
APP_PATH         ->  Internal path to application dir;
APP_URL          ->  URL to access aplication (i.e. http://www.domain.com);
APP_ROOT         ->  Application path (i.e. /www/app/public_html/);
APP_MODE         ->  Values: 'DEV' for development (default) and 'PROD' for production mode;
DB_LAYER         ->  Class name used to manipulate the access to database, using BasicDb class by default;
TEMPLATE_ENGINE  ->  Class name used to manipulate a Template system, using TemplateEngine class by default;
ASSETS_DIR       ->  Default name to assets dir into web public access, APP_ROOT/assets/ by default;
LOG_PATH         ->  Default name to log dir where is stored log files,  APP_PATH/log/ by default;
CACHE_PATH       ->  Default name to cache dir where is stored cached files, APP_PATH/cache/ by default;
PAGE_NOT_FOUND   ->  Application Controller name of default for page not found,  'NotFoundController' by default;
SYS_ERROR        ->  Application Controller name of default for system error message,  'SysErrorController' by default;
LANG             ->  Application language, used to some system messages. See BASE_PATH/i18n. 'en' by default;

By default all paths used, must have a final slash '/', like "/my/log/dir/".

docblock.description: Framework version
Store all configurations of application.
docblock.long-description: Format: $config['config'] = Array - Basic configurations, index are the same properties of Object. $config['route'] = Array - Configuration about how controller/action/module are invoke.

docblock.description: The routing system.
docblock.long-description:
In this context a 'segment' of URI is a one of many parts separated by '/'.

In example '/my/route/test' there are three segments.

 The route processing obey the follow sequence jumping to the next when not found:
     1 - Search for direct route; (no URI params)
     2 - Search for previous segment direct route; (no URI params)
     3 - Search if exist a method in controller of route '/';
     4 - Search for controller name;
     5 - Search for named params in route;
     6 - Load Not Found Controller;

 Route format:   $route[URI][METHOD] = Array('ControllerName', 'Action', 'ModuleName');
                 $route[URI][METHOD] = '/othet/route';
                 METHOD can be: *, get, post, put, delete;
                 When to use *, the others for the same URI will be skipped;
 uri             => the relative path of resource like: /article/firstArticle ;
 ControllerName  => the file name (without extension) of controller inside 'controller/' dir;
 Action          => the method name of controller;
                    if not specified, means that the action will be a method from Controller ;
 ModuleName      => the module name inside 'APP_PATH/module/' dir;
                    it means that the controller will be called from this module;

Route examples:

     // Module 'Admin' has controller 'UserAdmin' with method 'index'
     $route['/admin/user']['*']   = Array('UserAdmin', 'index', 'Admin');

     // Controller 'Home' has 'index' method (implicit)
     $route['/about']['*']        = Array('Home');

     // Controller 'Blog' has 'index' method
     $route['/blog']['*']         = Array('Blog', 'index');

There are a optional behaviour when an additional segments in a URI are put as argument to the method called, example:

     $route['/about']['*']        = Array('Home');
     // if called URI '/about/John'
     // the part URI (segment) 'John' will be passed as argument to method when the programmer can catch this value
     function about($name) {
         echo $name;
     }

In this case method param $name is optional, if you need the value inside of called method.

Avoid this routes (don't works or works the wrong way):

   /blog/:id::name:   -> params together;
   /blog/post/:post:  -> get all, but depends of declared order;
   /blog/post/a:post: -> the previous route get this pattern;
   /blog/a:id:-:month:  -> allowed only one param per segment;

Take care with routes that have same segments in URI, like:

     $route['/']['*']          = Array('Main');
     $route['/buy/cpu']['*']   = Array('Buy');

     // If controller 'Main' has 'buy' method, this route won't work as you think
     $route['/buy/:component:']['*']  = Array('Components', 'buy');

docblock.description: Class Minify_CSS_Compressor
Compress CSS
docblock.long-description: This is a heavy regex-based removal of whitespace, unnecessary comments and tokens, and some CSS value minimization, where practical. Many steps have been taken to avoid breaking comment-based hacks, including the ie5/mac filter (and its inversion), but expect tricky hacks involving comment tokens in 'content' value strings to break minimization badly. A test suite is available.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Are we "in" a hack? I.e. are some browsers targetted until the next comment?

docblock.description: Class that manage funky cache files.
docblock.long-description: Funky cache simply write a raw html content to a file to improve speed access. This files used to be put on a public url path and auto-created when it's missing, using NotFoundController for example. Some methods can be overrided by a extended class to adapt to current features of application.

docblock.description: A simple Mailer class, for sending e-mails.
docblock.long-description: It is capable to send text or html messages.

docblock.description: Return Array of data stored on current object Mailer.
Set current charset of mail, default value 'utf-8'.
Set if mail is a html message, default value 'false'.
Set the subject of mail.
Set mail body.
Set headers of mail, like Reply-to, From.
Set To mail field.
docblock.long-description: You can use: to('name', 'email') or to('email') to( Array('reply@domain.com', 'reply@domain2.com', 'Liber' => 'djalmaoliveira@gmail.com') )

docblock.description: Add one or more destinations to mail.
Set original sender(s) to mail.
docblock.long-description: You can use: from('name', 'email') or from('email') from( Array('reply@domain.com', 'reply@domain2.com', 'Liber' => 'djalmaoliveira@gmail.com') )

docblock.description: Set Reply-To field with email address.
docblock.long-description: You can use: reply('name', 'email@domain.com') or reply('email@domain.com') reply( Array('reply@domain.com', 'reply@domain2.com', 'Liber' => 'djalmaoliveira@gmail.com') )

docblock.description: Add attachment files.
Try to deliver the mail to MTA.
docblock.long-description: Return true if get, or false otherwise.

docblock.description: Parse and return a standard list of mail addresses from Array specified.

docblock.description: Class Minify_HTML
Compress HTML
docblock.long-description:
This is a heavy regex-based removal of whitespace, unnecessary comments and tokens. IE conditional comments are preserved. There are also options to have STYLE and SCRIPT blocks compressed by callback functions.

A test suite is available.

docblock.description: "Minify" an HTML page

tag.name: param
tag.description: 'cssMinifier' : (optional) callback function to process content of STYLE elements. 'jsMinifier' : (optional) callback function to process content of SCRIPT elements. Note: the type attribute is ignored. 'xhtml' : (optional boolean) should content be treated as XHTML1.0? If unset, minify will sniff for an XHTML doctype.

docblock.description: Create a minifier object

tag.name: param
tag.description: 'cssMinifier' : (optional) callback function to process content of STYLE elements. 'jsMinifier' : (optional) callback function to process content of SCRIPT elements. Note: the type attribute is ignored. 'xhtml' : (optional boolean) should content be treated as XHTML1.0? If unset, minify will sniff for an XHTML doctype.

docblock.description: Minify the markeup given in the constructor

docblock.description: Generic class create feeds.
Default feed fields
Default feed item fields.
docblock.long-description: 'uid' is a unique identification of item. If 'permanent_url' has a real URL, then 'uid' will be replaced by it. 'datetime' field should have 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:II:SS' format.

docblock.description: Load data feed.
Return a RSS2 XML code of feed from loaded data.

tag.description: - Can be specified a feed content.

docblock.description: Show/print the xml data of type of feed specified, setting the correct header content-type.

docblock.description: Generic class to manipulates some items like 'shop cart'.
docblock.long-description: It uses session to store this items. Context is like a namespace to separate the stored data.

docblock.description: Insert a item and return id of it.
docblock.long-description: If $id specified, $data will be replace current data stored.

docblock.description: Get a item from cart by a specified $id.
docblock.long-description: If you specify a $field, it will return the value of it stored on $item. If not specified any args, it will return all Array of items.

docblock.description: Clear all Cart or specified $id on stored cart.
Search if a item exists in cart.
docblock.long-description: You have to specify a key/value Array to search on cart and will return id of it if matched.

docblock.description: Check and retrieve value of $data from specified $field.
docblock.long-description: $data must be Array or Object to get it.

docblock.description: Class that provide some informations from HTTP request and do some action to HTTP response.
Response a status code header specified.
Response a content type specified.
docblock.long-description:
Usage:

// by shortcuts:
    Http::contentType( 'xml' );
// by specified content-type:
    Http::contentType( 'application/vnd.ms-excel' );
// charset:
    Http::contentType( 'json', 'utf-16' );

tag.name: param
tag.description: Shortcuts avaliable: pdf, gzip, zip, json, xml, gif, jpeg, png, css, plain, html.

docblock.description: Check if is a SSL connection.
docblock.long-description: @return boolean determined if it is a SSL connection

docblock.description: Check if the request is an AJAX request.
Return the requested method name in lowercase.
Do a cleaning .
Return a query value sent by method GET from $_GET var.
docblock.long-description:
Usage:

  // get a query value
      Http::get('name');
  // indicate if method request is GET
      Http::get();

docblock.description: Return a post value sent by method POST from $_POST var.
docblock.long-description:
Usage:

  // get a post value
      Http::post('name');
  // indicate if method request is POST
      Http::post();

docblock.description: Return a identified index from $_COOKIE var.
docblock.long-description:
Usage:

  // get a cookie value
      Http::cookie('name');
  // indicate if there are cookie values
      Http::cookie();

docblock.description: Return a specifield uploaded file from $_FILES var.
docblock.long-description:
Usage:

  // get a file uploaded
      Http::file('name');
  // indicate if there are file uploaded
      Http::file();

docblock.description: Class that manipulates extraction from databases.
Return the SQL code of table creation.
docblock.long-description: Return Array of tables names with its SQL code.

docblock.description: Return the SQL code of view creation specified.
docblock.long-description: Return Array of view names with its SQL code.

docblock.description: Return the constraints(PRIMARY and FOREIGN KEYS) of $tables specified.
Return an array of SQL Insert code of each data retrieved from $tables specified, by table name.
docblock.long-description: If specified $destFolder, each table data will be written on a file like 'tableName.sql' on this folder and return the path to this file instead of data. Remember that you have to remove the files written after its use. Usage: ->tableData('customer'); // return Array('customer'=>'INSERT ...'); ->tableData('customer', '/home/user/sql/'); // written on '/home/user/sql/customer.sql' ->tableData('customer', 'temp/'); // written on 'APP_PATH/temp/customer.sql'

docblock.description: Return if $table is table or not.

docblock.description: Class that manipulate produced logs in general.
Do the last action with log messages stored.
docblock.long-description: The default on error behavior is: DEV => open a popup window showing actual information about error and enviroment. PROD => call to SYS_ERROR controller defined. Both APP_MODE write a file on /log folder with the pattern [yyyymmdd.log].

docblock.description: Set a handler function to control the behavior of log messages.
docblock.long-description: The behavior of this function will be called before the default behavior, if you don't want the default behavior, then call die() or exit on $func.

docblock.description: Add a log message from current error triggered.
Return a String of current error and enviroment information.
Adds a message log.
Write current log to file.
Return textual stored log.
Generate a html content to show a popup with PHP error.
